SENT.plain: A 35 year old female presented with recurrent ventricular tachycardia 5 years after she had undergone surgical repair of double chambered right ventricle
Electroanatomical mapping showed a localised scar in the apex with double potentials and good pace map
Ablation here resulted in non-inducibility of ventricular tachycardia

We hypothesise that the scarring in the apex is the result of sustained pressure overload and becomes arrhythmogenic similar to the apical scar in patients with mid-ventricular hypertrophic cardiomyopathy
